title: Would, Used To Or Simple Past

questions.question: He …………….. smoke but now he has stopped.
questions.description: We use used to talk about past habits and states.

questions.question: She ……….. always bring us nice gifts.
questions.description: Both would and used to can be used to talk about repeated actions in the past.

questions.question: I ………………… go skiing but now I don’t.
questions.description: We use 'used to' to talk about past states.

questions.question: You used to hate him, ……………….?
questions.description: Used to is not used in the question tags. We use 'did' here because the statement is in the past tense.

questions.question: ……………….. play basketball at college?
questions.description: In a formal style, used to is often used as a modal auxiliary verb. In this case, questions and negatives are made without do. In an informal style we make questions and negatives with do.

questions.question: I ………………… like classical music, but now I do.
questions.description: When we make negatives, not can go before or after to. Did not use to is also possible here in an informal style.

questions.question: I …………………. have any interest in politics.
questions.description: Did not use to and used not to are possible here. Did not used to is not considered correct.

questions.question: I …………….. in Mumbai for 13 years.
questions.description: We do not use ‘used to’ to simply say what happened at a past time or how long it took. Those meanings are expressed with the simple past.

questions.question: I ………………… be afraid of dogs.
questions.description: Would cannot be used to talk about past states.

questions.question: I couldn’t understand them because I ………………… their accent.
questions.description: If you are not used to something, it is not familiar to you.

questions.question: It took me quite some time to get ………………… alone.
questions.description: We use an ing form after get used to. The infinitive is not possible in this structure.

questions.question: I …………….. to London twice last month.
questions.description: We do not use ‘used to’ to simply say what happened at a past time or how long it took. Those meanings are expressed with the simple past.
